pr_title: iOS - SwiftLint: Reduce line length complexity.

timeline.bodyText: I believe \n can be omitted if the \ at the end of the previous line is removed.
timeline.author: nikklassen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -20,10 +20,18 @@ import UIKit
 
 let kConfirmationSegueIdentifier = "confirmationSegue"
 let kHeaderDescription =
-  "You have chosen to delete your #APPNAME# Account. This will result in automatic withdrawal from all studies.\nBelow is a list of studies that you are a part of and information on how your response data will be handled with each after you withdraw. Please review and confirm."
+  """
+  You have chosen to delete your #APPNAME# Account. This will result in automatic withdrawal from all studies.\
+  \nBelow is a list of studies that you are a part of and information on how your response data will be handled \

replies.bodyText: No, \n is used to render a line break in UI and \ is used for the compiler to consider the next line for the same string.
replies.author: tushar-boston

replies.bodyText:
No, newlines are included if you don't include \
"""
line1
line2
"""

is the same as
"""
line1\
\nline2
"""
replies.author: nikklassen

timeline.author: nikklassen
